Data

Source: vignettes/Data.Rmd
Data.Rmd

This vignette provides a brief summary of the products made available from the package, encapsulating useful information about the data. Every abstract is taken directly from the product provider official website, links for which can be found in the text.

Agricultural Sector

The agricultural sector contains crop data measured on the field or reported by the producers. Examples include crop development, biomass accumulation and leaf area index.

NASS

The National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) of the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) conducts hundreds of surveys every year and prepares reports covering virtually every aspect of U.S. agriculture. Production and supplies of food and fiber, prices paid and received by farmers, farm labor and wages, farm finances, chemical use, and changes in the demographics of U.S. producers are only a few examples. NASS is committed to providing timely, accurate, and useful statistics in service to U.S. agriculture. For more information, visit the NASS website.

Quick Stats

The Quick Stats Database is the most comprehensive tool for accessing agricultural data published by the USDA National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS). Quick Stats contains official published aggregate estimates related to U.S. agricultural production, available in county, state, or country level.

The data include the total crops and cropping practices for each county, and breakouts for irrigated and non-irrigated practices for many crops, for selected States. The database allows custom extracts based on commodity, year, and selected counties within a State, or all counties in one or more States. The county data includes totals for the Agricultural Statistics Districts (county groupings) and the State. The download data files contain planted and harvested area, yield per acre and production.

NASS develops these estimates from data collected through sample surveys conducted each year covering virtually every aspect of U.S. agriculture and the Census of Agriculture conducted every five years providing state- and county-level aggregates. For more information, visit the NASS website.

Cropland Data Layers

The National Agricultural Statistical Service (NASS) offers the Cropland Data Layers (CDLs), 1km geospatial maps of estimated crop land use. For more information, visit the NASS website.

Environmental Sector

The environmental sector contains data measured from meteorological stations or other devices, as well as statistically-predicted data (which may be based on satellite data). Examples include temperature, precipitation and soil composition.

Oak-Ridge National Laboratory

Oak Ridge National Laboratory is a multiprogram research laboratory managed by UT-Battelle, LLC, for the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE). The missions of ORNL are primarily for open research. Although a small percentage of ORNL’s work is classified or restricted under its growing national security programs, the majority of the laboratory’s work is published in the open literature. Many of its facilities are user facilities, which means that they are available to researchers from other national labs, academia and industry. For more information, visit the ORNL website.

Daymet

Daymet is a research product of the Environmental Sciences Division at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Oak Ridge, TN. It provides long-term, continuous, gridded estimates of daily weather and climatology variables by interpolating and extrapolating ground-based observations through statistical modeling techniques. Daymet data products provide driver data for biogeochemical terrestrial modeling. Daymet weather variables include

  • minimum temperature,
  • maximum temperature,
  • precipitation,
  • vapor pressure,
  • shortwave radiation,
  • snow water equivalent, and
  • day length

produced on a 1 km x 1 km gridded surface over continental North America and Hawaii from 1980 and over Puerto Rico from 1950 through the end of the most recent full calendar year. For more information, visit the ORNL website.
